page.title: 02Alms Houses,Calverton 1985
page.content: The Alms houses were built for poor and needy people.There were 6 Alms houses, 4 for people from Calverton and 2 from Beachampton.The cottages had 1 room upstairs and 1 room downstairs, there wasn't any mains water only a water pump outside the cottages.They were built in 1830 by Charles George Percival who was the rector of the parish for 38 years. These cottages were modernized in 1978. They were made into three cottages.On the west wall there is a plaque that says" DEO AC PAUPERIBUS MDCCCXXX" meaning To god and the poor 1830". We visited a lady who has lived in Calverton for 50 years she told us that you didn't have to pay rents or rates years ago,because there wasn't any mains water, but they do have to pay rent nowadays.
